Package Collecto

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • Collecto.Server
  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the server to which clients can connect to play games against each other. It creates a PlayerHandler object whenever a client connects to handle further communication and games with that client. It stores a queue which players can join if they want to play a game, an inGame list for players who are currently in a game, and a list of all connected clients. It also stores booleans for all additional support that it offers. To start up the Server class uses a Controller object to prompt the user for a valid port to start the server on. It also uses the TUI class to print logs of what is happening on the server.
    See Also:
    PlayerHandler, Controller, TUI

      private void startNewGame()
      Checks if there are at least 2 players in queue and if there are - handles process of creating new game: randomly determines the first player to start, creates a new Game instance adds and sets these two player as in-game players and calls PlayerHandler.startNewGame(Game, PlayerHandler) to trigger game start for both player clients.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method to start server.

        Firstly checks for provided program argument. If there is exactly one argument, tries to convert this argument to port. If other amount of arguments provided or provided argument cannot be converted to port, prompts user to input port manually until port is verified by starting dummy server on this port.

        Parameters:
        args - array of argument. Supposed to contain port argument
        See Also:
        Global.checkPort(String)

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts up the server and waits for clients to connect.

        Activated when the main(String[]) method successfully proceeds. Waits for connection of client, starts a new thread of PlayerHandler and after client disconnects server doesn't stop because of infinite loop.

      • addPlayer

        protected void addPlayer​(PlayerHandler player)
        Adds provided player to list of players. Used when player successfully logs in.
        Parameters:
        player - player to add to list

      • removePlayer

        protected void removePlayer​(PlayerHandler player)
        Removes provided player from list of players. Being used with connection closure of player.
        Parameters:

        public boolean checkPlayer​(java.lang.String playerName)
        Checks if provided playerName is already taken in this server.
        Parameters:
        playerName - name of the player to check
        Returns:
        true if the name is already in the system, false otherwise

        Checks if provided client is already in queue.
        Parameters:
        client - client to check queue status for
        Returns:
        true if client is in queue, false otherwise

      • addToQueue

        protected void addToQueue​(PlayerHandler client)
        Checks if provided client is not currently in game and if he is not, adds client to queue and calls startNewGame() to handle possible new game start.
        Parameters:
        client - client to add to queue
        Requires:
        client != null
        Ensures:
        client can be added only when not in game

      • removeFromQueue

        protected void removeFromQueue​(PlayerHandler client)
        Removes provided client from queue if it is already in it.
        Parameters:
        client - client to remove from queue
        Requires:
        client != null

      • getPlayers

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getPlayers()
        Returns names of all players currently being on server.
        Returns:
        array of names of all players currently being on server

      • startNewGame

        private void startNewGame()
        Checks if there are at least 2 players in queue and if there are - handles process of creating new game: randomly determines the first player to start, creates a new Game instance adds and sets these two player as in-game players and calls PlayerHandler.startNewGame(Game, PlayerHandler) to trigger game start for both player clients.

      • gameEnded

        protected void gameEnded​(PlayerHandler client)
        Ends game for provided player by removing this player from inGame array.
        Parameters:
        client - client to remove from inGame
        Requires:
        client != null
        Ensures:
        client is removed from inGame is it was there

      • isInGame

        protected boolean isInGame​(PlayerHandler client)
        Determines provided player in-game status. Returns true if player is in game, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        client - client to check status of
        Returns:
        true if player is in game, false otherwise
        Requires:
        client != null
